SEARCH
Package simu.model

Class ServicePoint

java.lang.Object
simu.model.ServicePoint
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<ServicePoint>
public class ServicePoint extends Object implements Comparable<ServicePoint>
Represents a service point in the simulation, managing a queue of customers and simulating service times using a random generator.

This class tracks metrics such as total usage time, tasks serviced, average service time, throughput, and queue statistics. Each service point can schedule service completion events and handle customers in its queue.

Features include:

  • Queue management for incoming customers
  • Service time generation using a specified ContinuousGenerator
  • Event scheduling via EventList
  • Tracking of performance metrics like utilization, throughput, and waiting times
  • Methods to reset state, retrieve statistics, and visualize the queue

This class implements Comparable to allow prioritization based on the next customer's arrival time in the queue.

    • ServicePoint

      public ServicePoint(ContinuousGenerator generator, EventList eventList, EventType type)
      Create the service point with a waiting queue.
      Parameters:
      generator - Random number generator for service time simulation
      eventList - Simulator event list, needed for the insertion of service ready event
      type - Event type for the service end event

    • removeQueue

      public Customer removeQueue()
      Remove customer from the waiting queue. Here we calculate also the appropriate measurement values.
      Returns:
      Customer retrieved from the waiting queue

    • beginService

      public void beginService()
      Begins a new service, customer is on the queue during the service Inserts a new event to the event list when the service should be ready.

    • getServicePointUtilization

      public double getServicePointUtilization()
      Returns the utilization of this service point. Utilization is calculated as total usage time divided by the current simulation time.
      Returns:
      the utilization of the service point

    • getServiceThroughput

      public double getServiceThroughput()
      Returns the throughput of this service point. Throughput is calculated as the number of serviced tasks divided by the current simulation time.
      Returns:
      the throughput of the service point

    • getAverageServiceTime

      public double getAverageServiceTime()
      Returns the average service time for customers at this service point.
      Returns:
      the average service time

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(ServicePoint o)
      Compares this service point to another based on the arrival time of the customer at the head of their respective queues.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<ServicePoint>
      Parameters:
      o - the other ServicePoint to compare with
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this service point's head customer has a later, equal, or earlier arrival time than the other's
